question: Qarafa Necropolis, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located in which country?
explanation: The Qarafa Necropolis, also known as the City of the Dead or the Cairo Necropolis, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site which is part of the "Historic Cairo" located in Egypt. It houses a series of vast Islamic-era necropolises and cemeteries surrounded by the Cairo Citadel/Citadel of Saladin and Mokattam Hills. City of the Dead necropolis has been developed over many centuries and contains both the graves of Cairo's common population as well as mausoleums of Egypt's historical rulers and elites.
